title: Kirk Powers Blue Jays to 10-1 Win Over Yankees in ALDS Opener
snippets: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. said goodbye to a slump in his opening at-bat Saturday. Alejandro Kirk used his first swing to show that his bat remained as hot as ever.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiigFBVV95cUxQYVpvT0FtNE03Z3lmNmwzdHNYWlVLN3RONndyc29jUjZQUGxlQUFPMzZ2aUlfcm95dWltRUFwMEVNaU9JTFdXUll0dWhHSnh1dEtaZHNSYVdzaFVmTVBNbnFta1B2b0pUSWN6TDhpS1hyNXYtcEhmZDlsQWl6a2JNNHZnLUZqeERJVWc?oc=5" target="_blank">Blue Jays Make Decision on Bo Bichette f

Between Vladimir Guerrero Jr. delivering a major moment, erasing a playoff losing streak and forcing the Yankees to burn through five relievers, the Blue Jays nearly checked every box in Saturday’s win.
The Toronto Blue Jays will have to wait a little longer for Bo Bichette to make his return to the lineup.¬†

The Blue Jays have won 10-1 in Game 1 of the American League Division Series against the New York Yankees. The two teams were playing at Rogers Centre on Saturday for the first game between Toronto and New York in the MLB playoffs. The Yankees and Jays go back to the Rogers Centre in Game […]
titles: Blue Jays open ALDS with blowout win over Yankees

Blue Jays overpower Yankees to open ALDS with statement win

Blue Jays win 10-1 in Game 1 of ALDS vs. Yankees
summary: Alejandro Kirk led the Toronto Blue Jays to a 10-1 victory over the New York Yankees in Game 1 of their American League Division Series with his second consecutive two-homer game. This win marks the Blue Jays' first post-season victory in nine years, highlighted by a strong performance from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and effective strategy that exhausted the Yankees' bullpen, utilizing five relievers.

title: Collier Cancels Meeting with WNBA Commissioner Amid Dispute
snippets: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled her meeting with WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert next week, sources told ESPN.
Engelbert claimed there were inaccuracies in Collier's fiery tirade against WNBA leadership

Minnesota forward Napheesa Collier canceled a meeting with WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert expected to take place next week, a person familiar with the situation told The Associated Press on Saturday night.

summary: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled a planned meeting with WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert, according to sources. This decision follows Engelbert's claims of inaccuracies in Collier's critical comments about WNBA leadership.

title: Security Fears Exclude Three Provinces from Election, Sparking Debate
snippets: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.
Three provinces will not be included "for security reasons", amid concerns over how representative the polls will be.
Syrians are voting indirectly, and President Ahmed al-Shara is appointing a third of the lawmakers. Still, some see this as a step forward after decades of dictatorship.
titles: What to expect as Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster
Syria holds first elections since Assad, but not in all provinces
Syria Chooses Its First Parliament Since End of Civil War
summary: Three provinces are excluded from upcoming polls in an unnamed country due to security concerns, raising doubts about the election's representativeness. While supporters see the vote as a potential milestone, critics view it as President Ahmed al-Shara's attempt to strengthen his power.

title: Two Dead in Attack at Manchester Synagogue; Six Arrested for Terrorism
snippets: Two Jewish people were killed in a car and stabbing attack at Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation Synagogue in Manchester on the holiest day in the Jewish religious calendar.
And Kemi Badenoch arrives in Manchester for Conservative conference.
A congregant in Manchester, England, described how fellow worshipers, including the rabbi, used their bodies to barricade the entrance as the assailant tried to force his way in.

Six people have been arrested on suspicion of commission, preparation and instigation of acts of terrorism after attack that left three dead

Counter-terrorism police have been given permission to hold four suspects in custody until Wednesday after this week‚Äôs attack at a Manchester synagogu
titles: What we know about Manchester synagogue attack
Manchester Synagogue Attack: PM Tells Protesters To ‚ÄòRespect Grief Of British Jews‚Äô
How an Attack on a Synagogue in Manchester Unfolded
Police given permission to hold Manchester synagogue attack suspects until Wednesday
summary: Two Jewish individuals were killed in an attack involving a car and stabbing at Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation Synagogue in Manchester, England, during the holiest day of the Jewish calendar. In response, congregants, including the rabbi, barricaded the entrance to prevent the assailant from entering further. Following the incident, six people have been arrested on suspicion of terrorism-related offenses. Counter-terrorism police have been authorized to detain four of the suspects until Wednesday. Concurrently, Kemi Badenoch arrived in Manchester for the Conservative conference.

title: Pereira Wins UFC Light Heavyweight Title in 80 Seconds at UFC 320
snippets: Alex Pereira won back the light heavyweight title with a technical knockout of Magomed Ankalaev at UFC 320 in Las Vegas.
Alex Pereira is the champion of the light heavyweights again after crushing Magomed Ankalaev in 80 seconds of Round 1 on Saturday at UFC 320.

Brazilian Alex Pereira scored a stunning first-round knockout win over Magomed Ankalaev to reclaim the UFC light heavyweight title at UFC 320 on Saturday night, with Merab Dvalishvili retaining his bantamweight crown in the co-main event.
titles: UFC 320: Pereira stuns Ankalaev with TKO to regain light heavyweight title
Pereira reclaims title in 80-second TKO of Ankalaev
Pereira dethrones Ankalaev to reclaim light heavyweight belt at UFC 320
summary: Alex Pereira reclaimed the UFC light heavyweight title with a first-round technical knockout victory over Magomed Ankalaev at UFC 320 in Las Vegas. The fight concluded in just 80 seconds, marking a significant win for the Brazilian fighter. In the same event, Merab Dvalishvili retained his bantamweight title.

title: Netanyahu Optimistic on Hostage Release by Oct. 13 Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks
snippets: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that he hopes Hamas will have returned all remaining hostages by Oct. 13.

Hamas said it would release all Israeli hostages but wants to negotiate elements of President Trump‚Äôs peace plan for Gaza. Adam Rasgon, a reporter for The New York Times in Jerusalem, explains where negotiations stand.
Israel and Hamas said they would work with President Trump‚Äôs plan to end the war, but a number of sticking points could derail efforts to reach a diplomatic breakthrough.
Israel and Hamas announced they‚Äôve agreed to parts of Trump‚Äôs plan to end the war.
titles: Trump urges Hamas to 'move quickly' on Gaza peace plan
Hamas Partially Accepts Trump‚Äôs Peace Plan
Trump‚Äôs Gaza Peace Plan: What to Know
Trump Warns Hamas ‚ÄòMust Move Quickly‚Äô To Release Hostages As Part Of His Peace Plan
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu expressed hope for the release of all hostages by Hamas by Oct. 13, following partial agreement to President Trump's 20-point Gaza ceasefire plan. While Hamas has agreed to release hostages and discuss governing Gaza with Palestinian technocrats, negotiations on several aspects of the plan remain. Both Israel and Hamas have shown willingness to work towards ending the conflict, but unresolved issues could impede a diplomatic breakthrough. The US President has cautioned Hamas about the limited time available to finalize the deal.

title: Netanyahu Vows Quick Hostage Return, Sends Team to Egypt for Gaza Plan Talks
snippets: Hamas will disarm "the easy way or the hard way", Israel's PM says after the group gave its response to a peace plan.

Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu said he wants to see hostages returned in the coming days. He also said a team has been sent to Egypt "to finalize technical details" of Trump's plan for the future of Gaza.
Both sides have reacted positively to a United States proposal for a cease-fire, but many details remain to be ironed out, including whether Hamas will disarm.
titles: Netanyahu says he hopes to announce hostage release in the 'coming days'
Netanyahu hopes Gaza hostages return home in coming days
Netanyahu Says Israel and Hamas Are on the Brink of a Hostage Deal
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu announced intentions to secure the return of hostages within days and has dispatched a team to Egypt to conclude technical aspects of Trump's Gaza plan. The hostages' families express cautious optimism, urging the government to seize this chance for resolution.

The event highlighted the fighters' growing prowess and discussed potential future matchups following their wins.

title: Brewers' Chourio Exits NLDS Game 1 with Hamstring Issue

After becoming the first player to collect three hits in the first two innings of a postseason game, Jackson Chourio left Saturday’s 9-3 NL Division Series victory over the Chicago Cubs with tightness in his right hamstring.

summary: Jackson Chourio, a star player for the Brewers, exited the first game of the National League Division Series due to an apparent hamstring re-injury. This occurred after he secured three hits in two innings and ran hard through first base on an infield hit.

title: Panthers Crush Lightning 7-0; NHL Preseason Highlights Penalties and Overtime Wi
snippets: In a wild end to the NHL preseason schedule for a pair of bitter rivals, the Florida Panthers defeated the Tampa Bay Lightning 7-0 in a memorable matchup Saturday night in which 65 penalties were called, totaling 312 minutes on the final stat sheet.
Evan Rodrigues scored a hat trick and added an assist, Mackie Samoskevich had a three-point game and Sergei Bobrovsky earned a shutout as the Florida Panthers blanked the Tampa Bay Lightning 7-0.

Dylan Larkin and Michael Brandsegg-Nygard scored two goals each, while Patrick Kane tallied three points as the Detroit Red Wings edged the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-5 in overtime. Both Michael Pezzetta and Cedric Pare recorded two points in the loss.
Shane Pinto found the back of the net, Linus Ullmark made 20 saves and David Perron scored the game-winning goal to help the Ottawa Senators beat the Montreal Canadiens 3-1.
Nikita Zadorov opened the scoring in the first period and ended it in the third with an empty netter as the Boston Bruins down the New York Rangers 4-1.
Travis Konecny tied the game late in the third period with his second goal before finishing the comeback with the shootout winner as the Philadelphia Flyers beat the New Jersey Devils 4-3.
Phillip Danault scored twice and picked up an assist while Brandt Clarke dished out two assists of his own to lead the Los Angeles Kings to a 5-4 victory in overtime over the Anaheim Ducks.
Jonathan Marchessault scored his first of the pre-season before rookie Joakim Kemell put home the overtime winner as the Nashville Predators beat the Carolina Hurricanes 3-2.
titles: Lightning, Panthers net 312 PIM in preseason tilt
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Panthers 7, Lightning 0
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Red Wings 6, Maple Leafs 5 (OT)
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Senators 3, Canadiens 1
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Bruins 4, Rangers 1
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Flyers 4, Devils 3 (SO)
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Kings 5, Ducks 4 (OT)
NHL Pre-Season Highlights: Predators 3, Hurricanes 2 (OT)
summary: In a series of NHL preseason games, the Florida Panthers dominated the Tampa Bay Lightning with a 7-0 victory, highlighted by Evan Rodrigues' hat trick and Sergei Bobrovsky's shutout. The game was notable for a total of 65 penalties amounting to 312 minutes. Other matches saw the Detroit Red Wings narrowly defeat the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-5 in overtime, the Ottawa Senators win against the Montreal Canadiens 3-1, the Boston Bruins overcome the New York Rangers 4-1, the Philadelphia Flyers edge out the New Jersey Devils 4-3 in a shootout, the Los Angeles Kings beat the Anaheim Ducks 5-4 in overt

title: Police Use Force on Protesters at Georgian Presidential Palace
snippets: Opposition protests turned violent as riot police used tear gas and water cannon after disputed local elections.
Demonstrators were trying to enter the presidential palace in Tbilisi. A former president had called on Georgians to protest for what he called the "last chance" to save the country.

TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Police in Georgia used water cannons and pepper spray on Saturday to push back protesters who tried to storm the presidential palace, as the South Caucasus country held a municipal election boycotted by the main opposition blocs amid a sweeping crackdown on dissent. Ten
titles: Police fire water cannon at Georgia protesters near presidential palace
Georgia: Police fire tear gas at anti-government protesters
Georgia‚Äôs police use water cannons to push back protesters trying to storm presidential palace
summary: In Tbilisi, Georgia, police deployed water cannons and pepper spray to repel protesters attempting to storm the presidential palace following a municipal election. The demonstrations, which turned violent, were part of opposition protests against the election results, viewed as the "last chance" to save the country according to a former president. The main opposition blocs had boycotted the election, citing a crackdown on dissent.

title: Russia Launches Pre-Dawn Airstrikes in Ukraine, Kills Five
snippets: At least five people were killed before dawn in another large-scale and wide-ranging assault.
Russia launched a massive airstrike at targets across Ukraine overnight, including at energy facilities, killing at least five people and wounding several others.

summary: Russia conducted a large airstrike on various targets across Ukraine, including energy facilities, resulting in at least five deaths and multiple injuries. This attack occurred before dawn.

title: Heavy Rains in Himalayas: 18 Dead, 7 Missing, Rescue Efforts Hindered
snippets: Heavy rains continue to disrupt rescue operations in Himalayan nation as authorities struggle to respond to the crisis.

Eighteen people died and seven remain missing after multiple villages were swept away in eastern Ilam district bordering India. The weather department warned that rain is likely to continue until Monday.
titles: At least 47 killed in Nepal as heavy rains trigger landslides, flash floods
Nepal: Deadly landslides, flash floods kill many
summary: Heavy rains in the Himalayan nation have hampered rescue efforts, resulting in 18 deaths and 7 missing after villages in eastern Ilam district were destroyed. The weather department predicts continued rainfall until Monday, complicating the crisis response.

title: UK Grants Police New Powers After Pro-Palestinian Protest Arrests
snippets: The move is not a ban on protests but "about restrictions and conditions", Shabana Mahmood tells the BBC.

Move follows arrest of almost 500 people at latest pro-Palestinian demonstration in London on Saturday

Ministers are to give police new powers to target repeated protests, aimed particularly at cracking down on demonstrations connected to Gaza, the Home Office has said.

The announceme
titles: Home secretary wants police to get more powers to restrict repeated protests
Police to get new powers to crack down on repeated protests, says Home Office
summary: The UK Home Office announced new police powers to move demonstrations that cause "repeated disorder," following the arrest of nearly 500 people at a pro-Palestinian protest in London. These measures specifically aim to address protests related to Gaza.

title: Judge Blocks Trump's Order to Deploy National Guard in Portland

summary: A federal judge has temporarily halted President Trump's order to deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, against local leaders' wishes. This decision stops the federalization and deployment of the Oregon National Guard to address unrest in Portland.

title: Three States Ban Coldrif Syrup After Deaths, Toxic Solvent Found
snippets: Three states ban the cough syrup after children die allegedly after consuming the product.
The Indian Health Ministry said in a statement that test samples of Coldrif cough syrup found a highly toxic industrial solvent. At least nine children died allegedly after consuming it.
titles: India probes possible cough syrup link to deaths of at least nine children
India: 3 states ban cough syrup after several children die
summary: Three states have banned Coldrif cough syrup after the Indian Health Ministry found a toxic industrial solvent in test samples. Nine children have reportedly died after consuming the product.
